data.title: Ok pizza place
data.text: Had lots of craft beers on tap but if your country boy with big appetite,  not the place for you. Pizzas are small and thin, no supreme  loaded pizza here. The food was good just was expecting   bigger filling pizzas.

data.title: Quality ingredients + Delicious pizza = return trips
data.text: As a native New Yorker, I know quality pizza starts with the best, freshest ingredients.  Fire in the Hole delivers and then some.  Pizza is crisp, the mozzarella is creamy and the sauce has the perfect seasoning.  I tried 3 different pizza slices and I could not chose a favorite.  All were winners.

data.title: Best pizza in Round Rock
data.text: We ordered pizza for the first time from these guys a couple of months ago after being tired of the chain pizza places.  What a wonderful surprise!  Crust is thin, sauce is not too acidic, and they put just the right amount of toppings on it.  Delivery was super fast, and the guy who delivered the pizza was friendly.  Don't just stop at the pizza, though, order the pretzel rolls with bacon butter.  There are three in an order, which is perfect for our family.  We don't order pizza from anyone else since we've found Fire in the Hole.

data.title: Great thin crust pizza
data.text: I love that the pizzas are thin crust.  You get to taste more of the toppings and less bread.  The crust was crispy and they were not skimpy with the toppings.  Great service.

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: I finally made it in to try this place with my husband tonight. We loved the decor and the feel of the restaurant! Well done in that regard. We came early and were seated right away. There was hardly anyone in there yet, but we waited almost 10 minutes for a server to approach the table. We'd had plenty of time and ordered right away. We ordered the Texas Toothpicks which are fried onions and jalapeños with ranch dipping sauce. They took awhile to come out, but they were very good. We also ordered two 2 topping pizzas. Both were very good! Fine for us, but the Italian sausage is spicy, so be warned if you don't like spice. The food was very very good, service was okay. We had a coupon and paid a very fair price, but might not be as pleased if we had paid full price. Regular prices for pizza are very high, while the rest of the menu is reasonable. I'm sure we will come back

data.title: A very nice evening out
data.text:
We had a lovely evening here, particularly enjoying the delicious food, friendly and courteous staff and the nice decor. This is a step up from many pizza places.
The food is prepared exactly to order and comes out fresh, hot and tasty. There werre three of us and really one pizza plius the chicken wings sytarter would have been quite sufficient. We ordered two and basically took two half pizzas home. The wine and beer selection is very good.
The wait staff were excellent real high quality service, which is a testament to their recruitment and training. Well Done we will be back for more

data.title: Great wings & pizza
data.text: Went here with a few coworkers on a recent business trip. The wings were really good, very smoky flavor and just the right amount of heat. The pizzas were also tasty and a good value. Great selection of beers as well.

data.title: Friday Family Night
data.text: Great Friday Family Night!  I was a little apprehensive about going with my 2 year old after reading some of the reviews, but decided to try it out anyway.  We had a party of 10 (2 kids) and Vince our waiter was awesome!!!  Upon arrival he immediately brought us all waters (without asking) and even brought the kid's waters in cups with lids.  I wasn't sure what kind of beers they had on tap, so I requested to try their lightest (Blue Bonnet).  I ended up ordering one along with the White Pizza.  My picky 2yr old loved the pizza, probably because it closely resembled plain cheese.  Only this one was far from ordinary cheese because it had a variety of yummy flavors!  The acoustic guy playing did a great job and was awesome! :)  We had a wonderful experience and will definitely be back.  However, if you do go with kids I recommend going early before sunset...downtown Round Rock has turned into quite the night life!  P.S. It is a little pricey, but well worth it.  A beer and a pizza with tip $25

data.title: Decent Food; Cool atmosphere
data.text: We were out drinking in DT R.R.  when we decided we were all hungry and needed to get some food. We ordered Pizza and some apps. The cauliflower dish was great and the pizza was good.

data.title: Fried Cauliflower
data.text: I went to the Fire in the Hole last weekend and for me it is a little noise space. The pizza is not the best because I like other type of crust but the fired cauliflower is fantastic.

data.title: Lunch with friends
data.text: Margherita pizza it was killer.  Great salads. Pretzel shrimp poor boy more than one person can eat. Reasonable prices.  The service was great. A full bar adds that something extra.

data.title: WAY too greasy
data.text: Service was good, it's a Wednesday night so it wasn't busy. But the pizza was SOOOO greasy. Literally just pouring off the pizza everywhere. My stomach immediately started hurting. We just asked to not be charged for one pizza and tried to eat the other one. I will leave a picture of our pepperoni pizza with the river of grease!

data.title: Good Pizza, beer selection good also....
data.text: Craft beer selection was great. Pizza was good...little steep $17 for a large pizza...that appears as a small so don't expect to fill up on the pizza. suggest getting 3 plus for a group of 4 people or so. Large would be good for 1 person.

data.title: Hair in Food... Rude General Manager
data.text: Took my wife out on a date tonight, away from the kids and decided to try something new. Things were going okay. Server was super sweet but she was the only one and had a ton of tables. Took about 20 mins to get our pizza and second bite into my slice I find hair in a piece of pulled chicken. No biggie... I've managed restaurants for 15 years and things happen. Server apologizes and notified the general manager. General Manager Greg came to the table and the first thing he did was ask my wife if she was sure this wasn't her hair as nobody in the kitchen has hair like that. Really... Accusing my wife?! Then he asked if we were going to eat the rest of the pizza or do we want a new one made. Again... Really?! Why would we finish eating the pizza that had hair in it. He told us a new pizza would be out in 10 minutes, and after a few minutes in just utter disbelief we asked for the check so that we could leave. Greg dropped off the check for the really bad $8 salad and on the way out he stood smug behind the bar and told us to have a great evening. I'll show you a great evening by writing this review. You ruined date night and we won't be back. There are better restaurants in the area where the management team actually cares for the guests.

data.title: Good Pizza & Nice Setting
data.text:
I really enjoy that downtown Round Rock is finally starting to build critical mass for food and entertainment, so last weekend my wife and I decided to try Fire in the Hole.  Overall, I enjoyed it, but there are a few things to be desired.

The food: I thought the fried cauliflower appetizer was very good.  So, off to a good start.  We ordered the Mushroom Pizza, and it was good.  The crust was thin and done just right, the kind you can only get from a real pizza oven.  However, for $17 it was (as mentioned before) on the small side.  We easily put this away (even after the appetizer).  And it’s really a shame they offer a gluten-free crust but charge a full $4 more on top of the already high price.  

The drinks & service: Stick with beer and wine.  The staff tends to be young (which is fine), but it’s clear they don’t know their way around a bar and the mixed drinks showed.  I don’t blame them, but I do blame the mgt. for not training their team.  If you offer a cocktail menu, then know how to make them, especially at those prices.  Overall service was good, and I think it helped we were seated near the bar.

The atmosphere: In a nice historic building and rather cozy.  There was a band up front that was playing some nice Blues, and even though we were close, it was not too loud (at least for us – we could still talk).  

Overall, I’d go back, but wouldn’t plan to be too hungry and would stick to beer or wine.

data.title: Super thin crust pizza
data.text:
Walked in early one evening... It appeared to surprise them that a lone woman wanted dinner. 
The marg. Pizza was ok. So super thin...with a chewy crust, if that was possible. Not a fan.

data.title: Eclectic!
data.text: This is the place to come for gourmet pizza in Round Rock.  My cousin lives in nearby Hutto so he brought my husband and I here for a real treat.  We got two varieties and both were delicious.  This is not your "run of the mill" pizza joint.  Everything about is top-notch.  If you are in the mood for pizza, this is where you want to go in Round Rock.

data.title: Bread, bread, bread
data.text: Eclectic pizzas, a few interesting sides...but mostly tastes like bread.  Not a good choice if you're gluten free, dairy free, low sugar, or simply want a filling meal.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: If you are tired of the commercial places for pizza and liking for something new, this place is the spot for you. Great brick oven pizza. The create your own is the way to go!!

data.title: Gourmet pizzas, lots of craft beers, rustic decor.
data.text: Luckily we found this restaurant. After checking out some pizza chains, which were either closed, or just take out. We found this place, situated in a downtown area of Round Rock. Small storefront, but great food, beer, and friendly service. Décor is pleasing with some repurposed items that are pretty cool. We had the Mexican pizza, which was very different, and very tasty. We tried some Octoberfest brews, and thoroughly enjoyed the décor and friendly helpful service. Would recommend this restaurant to all who like to try some unique, gourmet pizzas, in a rustic comfortable atmosphere. We'll certainly return if we're ever in the area.
